tool.name: MaxQuant Phosphopeptide ANOVA
tool.description: Perform ANOVA on merged and filtered data from phospho-peptide enrichment/MaxQuant pipeline

param.name: input_file
param.label: Filtered Phosphopeptide Intensities
param.help: [input_file] Phosphopeptide intensities filtered for minimal quality. First column label 'Phosphopeptide'; sample-intensities must begin in column 10 and must have column labels to match argument [sample_names_regex]

param.name: alpha_file
param.label: alpha cutoff level
param.help: [alpha_file] List of alpha cutoff values for significance testing; text file having one column and no header

param.name: intensity_column_regex
param.label: Intensity-column pattern
param.help: [intensity_column_regex] Pattern matching columns that have peptide intensity data (PERL-compatible regular expression matching column label)

param.name: imputation_method
param.label: Imputation Method
param.help: [imputation_method] Impute missing values by (1) using median for each sample-group; (2) using median across all samples; (3) using mean across all samples; or (4) using randomly generated values having same std. dev. as across all samples (with mean specified by [meanPercentile])

param.name: meanPercentile
param.label: Mean percentile for random values
param.help: [meanPercentile] Percentile center of random values; range [1,99]

param.name: sdPercentile
param.label: Percentile std. dev. for random values
param.help: [sdPercentile] Standard deviation adjustment-factor for random values; real number. (1.0 means SD equal to the SD for the entire data set.)

param.name: sample_names_regex
param.help: [sample_names_regex] Pattern extracting sample-names from names of columns that have peptide intensity data (PERL-compatible regular expression)
param.label: Sample-extraction pattern

param.name: sample_grouping_regex
param.help: [sample_grouping_regex] Pattern extracting sample-group from the sample-names that are extracted by 'Sample-extraction pattern' (PERL-compatible regular expression)
param.label: Group-extraction pattern

tool.help:
=========================================== Phopsphoproteomic Enrichment Pipeline ANOVA ===========================================
**Input files**
``input_file`` Phosphopeptides annotated with SwissProt and phosphosite metadata (in tabular format). This is the output from the "Phopsphoproteomic Enrichment Pipeline Merge and Filter" (``mqppep_mrgflt``) tool.
``alpha_file`` List of alpha cutoff values for significance testing; text file having one column and no header. For example:
::
0.2 0.1 0.05
**Input parameters**
``intensity_column_regex`` First column of ``input_file`` having intensity values (integer or PERL-compatible regular expression matching column label). Default: **Intensity**
``imputation_method`` Impute missing values by:
1. using median for each sample-group; 2. using median across all samples; 3. using mean across all samples; or 4. using randomly generated values where:
- ``meanPercentile`` specifies the percentile among non-missing values to be used as mean of random values, and - ``sdPercentile`` specifies the factor to be mulitplied by the standard deviation among the non-missing values (across all samples) to determine the standard deviation of random values.
``sample_names_regex`` PERL-compatible regular expression extracting the sample-name from the the name of a column of instensities (from ``input_file``) for one sample.
- For example, ``"\.\d+[A-Z]$"`` applied to ``Intensity.splunge.10A`` would produce ``.10A`` - Note that *this is case sensitive* by default.
``sample_grouping_regex`` PERL-compatible regular expression extracting the sample-grouping from the sample-name that was extracted with ``sample_names_regex`` from a column of intensites (from ``input_file``).
- For example, ``"\d+$"`` applied to ``.10A`` would produce ``10`` - Note that *this is case sensitive* by default.
**Outputs**
``imputed_intensities`` Phosphopeptide MS intensities where missing values have been **imputed** by the chosen method, in tabular format.
``imputed_QN_LT_intensities`` Phosphopeptide MS intensities where missing values have been **imputed** by the chosen method, quantile-normalized (**QN**), and log10-transformed (**LT**), in tabular format.
``report_file`` Summary report for normalization, imputation, and **ANOVA**, in PDF format.
**Authors**
``Larry C. Cheng`` (`ORCiD 0000-0002-6922-6433 <https://orcid.org/0000-0002-6922-6433>`_) wrote the original script.
``Arthur C. Eschenlauer`` (`ORCiD 0000-0002-2882-0508 <https://orcid.org/0000-0002-2882-0508>`_) adapted the script to run in Galaxy.
=================================== PERL-compatible regular expressions ===================================
Note that the PERL-compatible regular expressions accepted by this tool are documented at http://rdrr.io/r/base/regex.html
